data.title: The Top Tennis Academies in the World
data.meta_description: The best tennis academies from all over the World
data.text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands

Tennis Academy Amsterdam was founded in 2011 by Maria Sharapova’s coach, Sven Groeneveld and fellow Dutch coach, Roland Laurense. TAA has a safe and inspiring environment, where the development of the individual, in the broadest sense of the word, plays a central role.

A tailor made program is made for everyone who has the ambition to reach their full tennis potential. The Academy has an integrated approach wherein tennis, physical and mental practice, nutritional advice, tourney scheduling and injury prevention come together. Their multidisciplinary team of international coaches is supported by various partners to assist tennis players with all aspects of their development on a daily basis.

Georgia, USA

The founder of Atlanta’s Court Elite (ACE) Tennis Academy. Jeff Weaver, a USPTA certified P-1 instructor, has been developing top juniors in Atlanta, Georgia since 1992. The focus of ACE is on developing elite junior tennis players.

ACE also has an international boarding academy in Fortalesa, Brazil that houses a maximum of six players – the focus is on full-time development of top national and international players from around the world. ACE Tennis Brazil began operation in September of 2009. ACE Academy Brazil offers serious tennis students the opportunity to train at the highest possible level while experiencing another culture. This international tennis boarding academy exposes students to completely different game styles. This unique and exclusive program gives players the opportunity to train six hours a day on red clay.

National Centre, UK

The Annabel Croft Tennis Academy was founded in January 2009 by the former British No.1 and Tennis TV Presenter Annabel Croft and her husband Mel Coleman.

The academy has over over 320 weekly players participating in its program at the National Tennis Centre and 2 academies at 5 Star resorts in Cyprus and the Algarve.

The NTC (National Tennis Centre) is located in Roehampton. It is the home of British Tennis with the majority of the top players in the country using it as their training base, including Andy Murray and Anne Keovathong. The centre is a world class training facility and features 22 tennis courts with all surfaces covered including 6 indoor courts. The NTC also features a state of the art sports science area, gymnasium and running track.

Castelldefels, Spain

The Barcelona region of Spain has an international reputation for producing some of Europe's and the world's best tennis players and the Barcelona Tennis Academy aims to provide full-time or holiday players, whether they join for a week or for a year, the opportunity to enjoy a world-class training program in a beautiful setting.

The Academy moved in 2015 to a new in Castelldefels (20km from Barcelona) and boasts 21 clay courts, 11 padel courts, an outdoor pool, sauna, gym, aerobics studio, bar-restaurant, a kids play area, and a chill out zone. The Academy offers training programs for all ages and levels.

Barcelona, Spain

Founded in 2004 by Francis Roig, Alvaro Margets and Jordi Vilaró, all three continue to direct and personally oversee the daily running of the BTT Academy, recently strengthened in 2010 by the incorporation of Alberto Riba who has brought to the academy his high performance tennis experience previously acquired in his position as Managing Director of the Spanish Tennis Federation.

The Academy is a high performance centre situated in the grounds of the Club Esportiu Valldoreix in the town of Valldoreix near Barcelona. The principle aim is an integral preparation of student- tennis players of all standards and ages, looking to achieve their personal development as well as academic and optimum athletic skill enrichment.

Alberto Costa, Alex Corretja, Feliciano López, Fernando Verdasco, Marcel Granollers, Tommy Robredo, Teimuraz Gabashvili and Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova are just some examples of top international players that have all put their trust in the BTT Academy over the years.

Brett and Lavazza Tennis is a training Centre devoted to identifying young talent and delivering comprehensive, highly personalized coaching to players committed to their tennis development. Built on the vision of Master Coach Bob Brett, the Centre’s goal is to focus on long term development that enhances natural potential and gives each player the chance to play at his or her highest level.

A maximum of 24 full-time participants are accepted each year, ensuring a small program of exceptional quality that responds to each player's individual needs and aptitude. Week long focus programs are available throughout the year for those players wishing to benefit from the coaches advice and concentrate on specific skill sets.

The Centre is located in San Remo, Italy, renowned for its beautiful natural setting and mild climate. With cultural attractions and international airports within close driving distance, the Centre is a vantage point from which to explore the vibrant culture and history of the Italian Riviera.

Bolton, UK

The Bolton Tennis Academy has professional tennis coaches that have a track record of producing strong players in all age groups and from national, European, International & professional levels. USN Bolton Arena is 1 of 4 LTA accredited International High Performance Centres, the highest status awarded to tennis academies in the UK.

Players in the program progress through the coaching team as they reach the appropriate levels, which ensure that players are working with coaches who have the relevant experience for players to achieve the next level. The yearly squad syllabus is age and level specific. All squads have a tennis specific physical session included which focuses on the physical components within the set syllabus. The squads are run over a number of courts to allow all players the variety of hitting with other players of their level.

Barcelona, Spain

The Bruguera Tennis Academy was founded in 1986 and is run by ex-Spanish Davis Cup captain, Lluís Bruguera and former World No.3, Sergi Bruguera.

Lluís Bruguera, two-time winner at Roland Garros, runs the Academy, overseeing the coaching and participating in on-court work. His personal interest and involvement ensures that that the well-known Bruguera Method is carried out every day for the benefit of every player.

The Academy offers high performance tennis programs for young professionals and futures players, as well as weekly tennis courses to players of all levels. The Academy is located within 18 kilometers of Barcelona’s city centre, in ideal Mediterranean climate that allows for year-round tennis training outdoors. Notable Alumni include WTA players Sara Errani and Garbiñe Muguruza.

Florida, USA

Cañas Tennis Academy fulfills a lifelong dream that Guillermo Cañas, Martín García and Gustavo Oribe all had in common: to create a path for young individuals to achieve success in tennis and all facets of life.

Cañas Tennis provides an extensive tennis program that focuses on the technical, tactical, physical and mental development of the player which is the main foundation of the Argentinean methodology of teaching, while fulfilling the holistic needs of each player in his/her quest to achieve the highest growth possible. Cañas Tennis leadership devised a philosophy of coaching tennis through an “Integral System” in order to reach maximum success for each individual athlete.

The academy is open year round, and players can train for any length of time. With its great weather, superb tennis facilities, and abundance of tournaments, Miami is the perfect place to train.

California, USA

Taylor Dent reached a career-high ranking of 21 in the world and gained recognition as one of America's best Tennis Talents. In 2011, Taylor retired from the ATP Tour with four ATP singles titles, three Grand Slam serving records and wins over some of the biggest names in tennis. Because of his love for the game and passion for competitive play, Taylor teamed up with his father and wife to build Dent Tennis Academy.

While most tennis academies and clubs teach students the fundamentals of tennis very well, the Dent System goes beyond the fundamentals to teach students how to prepare for tournaments, how to hit like a pro, and most importantly, how to win. The Dent System of Training equips their students with the competitive advantages they must possess to be a champion on and off the court.

California, USA

Dimitar Yazadzhiev, a former World is the owner at the Dimitar Tennis Academy. The academy offers top quality tennis instruction for the competitive player who is determined and dedicated to excel to the next level.

With over 25 years of domestic and international coaching experience at some of the world's most recognized tennis facilities Dimitar has worked with many of the top ranked national and international junior players, amongst them, Grigor Dimitrov.

The Academy’s aim is to develop and enhance all aspects of successful tennis players, including technique, footwork, fitness, peak performance, nutrition, and strategy. Each camp or clinic includes specially designed fitness sessions with Certified Athletic Trainers / Certified Strength & Conditioning Specialists.

Estoril, Portugal

The Estoril Tennis Club was founded in 1945. The Club’s rich heritage and history form the basis of its evolving program and make it a very special part of the world tennis industry. The Club stages national and international tournaments including The Estoril Open, and hosts The Davis Cup, The Fed Cup, and The European Championships. It has its own tennis school, and the tradition of high-quality teaching is recognized both in Portugal and worldwide.

The club offers 14 clay, 4 hard, 1 synthetic grass, as well as 3 padel courts, an outdoor swimming pool, a Ballet school, a Pilates studio, a fitness studio, and a games room.

Florida, USA

The Evert Tennis Academy is a partnership between the Evert family, and IMG, the world’s largest sports marketing firm. As the proud home to more than 15 Grand Slam participants and 100 Division I college athletes, Evert Tennis Academy has a proven record of success in developing champions at the highest levels.

By combining the experience of a champion with world-class coaching, cutting-edge training methods and premier facilities the academy offers programs for players of all ages and abilities.

The centre offers strength and conditioning programs as well as mental coaching and nutritional education. Several of today’s top 100 players have spent time at the Evert Tennis Academy, including Madison Keys, Peng Shuai and Jesse Levine.

Alicante, Spain

The Ferrer Tennis Academy was started at the Jávea Tennis Club, by Javier Ferrer Ern, one of the current directors and brother of the professional tennis player David Ferrer.

The Player Development Program focusses on developing amazing technique and developes personalized training plans for each player, ensuring compliance with the set objectives and both the physical and psychological development of each of them. The trainings include a detailed supervision ofhow to play points and matches, where the tactics and strategies are analyzed and then tested again in competition. This gradual introduction to pressure and competition situations, develops technical expertise, tactical skills and mental toughness in the players, required to win championships. Options for training include; High Performance, Summer Camps, and Adult Programs at their tennis school.

Mallorca, Spain

The academy is led by Jofre Porta, renowned for having had professional links with Carlos Moyá and Rafael Nadal. He is a student and philosopher of tennis who dedicates a big part of his time and effort investigating on how to help tennis players maximize their potential.

The academy is the Research Centre in which Jofre Porta’s GlobalSystem methodology is developed. An avant-garde methodology of training that combines the technical-tactical-physical-mental aspects of a sportsman as such. Since they don’t believe in a line that separates one aspect from another, they integrate all aspects into a single system, in short, an integrated system. Programs are short, and long-term, and can include accommodation.

California, USA

Vitaly Gorin is the brains behind the Gorin Tennis Academy, situated in Northern California. The academy offers year-round programs that utilise intense drillings to develop and fine-tune technique. While the academy hasn’t produced any elite players yet, Gorin has guided many competitors into the top 100, including Dmitry Tursunov, Igor Kunitsyn and Jimmy Wang.

Coach Gorin believes that working with young aspiring tennis players carries a heavy moral obligation. This demands that every student receive the best possible education in order that they may reach their full tennis potential. It is this obligation that is at the center of the Gorin teaching philosophy.

Florida, USA

Tennis training at the IMG Academy Bollettieri Tennis program sets the standard by which all tennis academies are measured. A pioneer in the industry, it has developed champions at every level of the game and continues to produce complete players who have the technical, tactical, physical and mental skill to dominate the competition in any setting.

Boris Becker, Monica Seles, Jim Courier, Tommy Haas and Serena Williams and Venus Williams are just some of the players to come through the Bollettieri programme, which combines innovative athletic training techniques with intense academic study. Bollettieri himself remains one of tennis’ biggest characters, and prides himself on his ability to spot a champion.

Alicante, Spain

IQL Sports' mission is to provide high quality and innovative to all their clients, whether an individual player, or a as a group.

A tennis academy located on the Mediterranean coast, specifically in Benidorm, Spain. Thanks to the climate it is a perfect place for tennis all year round. There are 10 tennis courts; 6 hard (Green Set), and 4 clay courts. Programs offered in the academy include training for eilte, junior, groups, and also for tennis holiday goers looking to improve their social game.

Alicante, Spain

Juan Carlos Ferrero is the Sports Director of the JC Ferror Tennis Academy and in 2003 ranked the No.1 ATP player in the world.

The Academy was founded by Antonio Martínez Cascales in 1995 to continue the work that he and a group of collaborators had been carrying out at several schools in the area since 1980. What started in 1995 as a modest and small Academy, with only two tennis courts and a gym, is now one of the best tennis academies in the world.

The Academy provides players with new, private and high quality facilities and the coaching team is certified by the most prestigious world organizations with many years of experience. A 120,000m2 surface is specially and exclusively provided for the use and enjoyment of the players at the Academy. The JC Ferrero tennis academy provides different types of programs for players and adults: summer camp, year round training, short term training and adult programs.

Texas, USA

John Newcombe is undoubtedly one of the finest tennis players ever to set foot on a tennis court. His 6 Grand Slam titles lay testament to this claim.

Nestled in the rolling Texas Hill Country between San Antonio and Austin, the John Newcombe Tennis Ranch is one of the premier tennis facilities in the world. The world-class tennis program uses every aspect of tennis training to develop a player's full potential with a strong emphasis on match play and tournament competition. The coaches travel with players to tournaments to observe them in the heat of the battle and then return back to the Ranch to work on areas in need of improvement.

The adult tennis programs are unlike any other in the world. Pros entertain you throughout your stay, joining you for meals, having fun on the courts and even singing Karaoke in an Aussie bar in the evenings. A 4:1 Guest to Pro ratio ensures that everyone receives the ultimate in-group instruction, and private lessons are always available.

Ottignies, Belgium

Former World No.1 Justine Henin opened the Academy in 2007 after her remarkable career as a tennis player. She aims to convey a range of values of sports training like courage, fighting spirit, respect, and discipline.

The philosophy of Justine Henin Tennis Academy is based on the fact that the performance should not be seen as an end in itself. The result of an activity is essentially the result from a state of mind.

Bree, Belgium

Kim Clijsters, a famous resident of Bree, has an 18-court tennis academy with state-of-the-art equipment and a team of tennis and wider health professionals. When Clijsters opened the Academy in 2014 it was her vision to bring together all the needs of tennis players under one roof.

For aspiring pros there is the opportunity to join the college program, aimed at players who are still studying at university, college or those wanting to do home studies. Players receive 10-15 hours of tennis coaching per week (including at least two hours of private lessons), in addition to five or six hours of fitness training (of which at least one hour will be one-on-one).

The programme also includes HawkEye testing, medical screening and an injury prevention programme, as well as a KCA trainer at four international tournaments a year. There is also a Pro Tour/Practice Programme for players with professional ambitions. The pro Tour programme is a holistic programme where a player can tap into many services like a Snapshot test –analysis of a specific stroke with the use of Hawkeye cameras, a fitness performance test, a Dexa Body scan as well as osteopathic screening, mental mindflow screening and massage.

There are currently between 25 and 30 aspiring pros training at the academy and around 300 players aged 3 to 70 plus playing one or more times a week.

Marbella, Spain

The name Klaus Hofsäss is synonymous with success in German tennis having coached Steffi Graf, arguably the best woman tennis player of all time. Klaus is a highly-qualified tennis coach, having trained many top 100 ATP/WTA players and his experienced coaching team will take your tennis to the next level.

At this academy you'll experience tennis training in the mountains of Marbella. Wake up to scenic views of tennis courts overlooking the mountains. Many professional tennis players have chosen this academy, including Victoria Azarenka who started her tennis journey here. You can join the Klaus Hofsäss Tennis Academy any time of the year with facilities that include 4 clay courts, 5 hard courts, a pool, gym, and residence villas for adults.

Sophia-Antopolis, France

The academy utilises the name and reputation of Patrick Mouratoglou, who has trained tennis champion Serena Williams, and notable players Marcos Baghdatis, Grigor Dimitrov, and Aravane Rezai.

The tennis academy is currently under construction (after relocating from Paris) and by summer 2016 will offer tennis-training infrastructure that is second-to-none in Europe. The facility will include a 3,000m² accommodation center with 34 clay & green courts (including 8 indoor courts), a center court for shows & tournaments, Play Sight video equipment on 6 courts, an indoor/outdoor multisport & gym training center, an athletics track, and an outdoor pool.

Bangalore, India

The Tennis Village was established in 1995 by Krishna Bhupathi, father of Indian tennis star Mahesh Bhupati, in the single-minded pursuit of a passion “to teach the game, and teach it right”.

The Tennis Academy aspires to provide those children with a genuine interest and an inherent desire to learn tennis, an opportunity. If a talent is spotted, the Academy takes the onus of guiding the young student towards achieving his or her potential.

The Academy has a 10-member team of dedicated, professional and experienced tennis players who are devoted to coaching the upcoming talent of India. The facilities include 6 Plexicushion courts (3 floodlit), accommodation for 48 players, gym, and swimming pool.

The Tennis Village has trained Mahesh Bhupathi, Sania Mirza, Rohan Bopanna & a host of National tennis players in India.

Brisbane, Australia

Founded in December 2009, and promoted as Australia's leading tennis academy, Pure Tennis Academy is full service tennis management company for all levels of play, offering state-of-the-art technology. The Academy is committed to providing superior services that focus on results for every player, whether you have just taken up the game or are looking to make a career on the professional circuit.

The Academy's headquarters has been established at the international world class tennis facility at Griffith University, (Mount Gravatt campus) Brisbane, Australia. The facilities include 12 plexi cushion court complex, 4 brand new synthetic grass courts, a gym, state of the art swimming pool and running tracks.

The Academy provides high performance programs that have pathways to guide students from beginner level right through to elite stages. They are also a provider of Tennis Australia's ANZ 'Hot Shots' Program. Their coaches speak multiple languages ranging from German, French, Italian, Croatian and English.

Mallorca, Spain

While it hasn’t opened yet we’re tipping that the Rafael Nadal Tennis Academy will soon make its way to the top tennis academies in the world. It will begin operations in 2016 for young players to train with the method that has led ‘Rafa’ to be World No.1, with the guarantee of being surrounded by the best coaches and the technical team in the tennis. All this will be offered on a training campus with top facilities and high-end technology.

In collaboration with the technical team that has been working with Rafa throughout his career, Rafael Nadal and his uncle (also his long time coach) Toni Nadal have created the training system that will be used at the Academy.

There’s a lot of interest to see how Rafael Nadal will translate his success on the court to the success of young players. Located in Nadal’s hometown, the Academy will also focus on general education to make sure that young players aren’t giving up on academic learning to pursue their dreams on making it big on the tour.

Florida, USA

The Tennis Academy was acquired in 1986 from the legendary Harry Hopman. Harry Hopman's philosophy and focus on fitness made Hopman one of the most successful tennis coaches in history, and became the foundation of the Saddlebrook Program.

That focus is still under the leadership of the tennis Program Director, Howard Moore, and the intense drills that are run during daily clinics. The Hopman Tennis Program at Saddlebrook offers tennis programs for players of all ages and ability levels. The renowned Tampa tennis facility attracts enthusiasts from across the globe, and is home to 45 tennis courts including all four Grand Slam surfaces.

Saddlebrook Tennis has the ability to cater to the true tennis fanatics who choose to participate in our demanding five-hour a day program, offered 365 days a year, while also providing corporate meeting attendees with an opportunity to fit in a quick lesson or a few sets of competitive play.

The combination of tranquility, privacy and exclusivity on the property coupled with the energy of the world's top players training to reach their goals of ATP and WTA success has made Saddlebrook a historic and legendary training ground. In fact, guests have enjoyed watching some of the world's best players during their training at Saddlebrook, including in the past: Jim Courier, Pete Sampras, Martina Hingis, James Blake, and currently, John Isner, Jack Sock, and Bob and Mike Bryan.

Florida, USA

A world-class tennis academy, founded in 1998 by Emilio Sánchez Vicario (former World #7 player) and Sergio Casal, the Academia Sánchez-Casal is an educational institution with the highest standards and a proven track record in developing successful young people through all stages of their lives. The Florida Campus is managed by Emilio Sanchez himself, the Director of Sanchez-Casal. This campus is located in a peaceful environment, close to a lake, with abundance of fauna and flora, close to beautiful beaches and Naples which is the main city closeby.

Academia Sánchez-Casal believes that using tennis and education within the 'Academia' framework as the vehicle for personal development, student athletes will continue to be good citizens of the world long after they leave their care. Their Mission at the Academia Sánchez-Casal is "creating opportunities in tennis, in education, in life." There is a focus on teaching and harnessing the core values of education, competitiveness, enthusiasm and industriousness.

The academy has a unique training system as well as a high performance research centre. This successful method enables students to obtain scholarships in universities across the United States, and has been used by professional ATP tennis players Andy Murray, Grigor Dimitrov and Juan Monaco and WTA players Svetlana Kuznetsova, Daniela Hantuchova and Tamira Paszek.

Florida, USA

Internationally recognized as one of the top developmental coaches and coaching educators in tennis. Over 29 years, Saviano has coached and developed more than 50 ATP & WTA players. Ranking in the top-50 in singles with wins over top-10 players on multiple occasions en route to four ATP Tour titles.

This academy is the place where junior players enjoy growth in rankings and maturity as they progress through the age divisions; where college-seeking players realize their goal of playing collegiate tennis while empowering learned self-belief; where collegiate players hone their individual skills for the betterment of their collective teams; And where Tour-level players reach their career potential by completing their total player package.

The Saviano Method is an ever-evolving program serving competitive tennis players. These programs are exclusive to the academy and taught by elite instructors with global experience in the competitive game at the junior, collegiate and professional levels.

Offenbach am Main, Germany

The Tennis University was founded by Alexander Waske, Davis Cup and ATP player, with Rainer Schüttler in 2010. Their life motto and the philosophy of the academy is that each player should work as hard as they can to be the best tennis player that they personally can be. Players are encouraged to pursue not just sporting success, but personal development as well.

The University now trains 30+ players with 11 coaches year round. Besides the regular tennis training at the tennis academy, they also offer camps for young and adult players who want to improve their game and share their passion for the sport. Top-players such as Tommy Haas and Jürgen Melzer have stopped by the tennis academy to prepare for their matches.

Moscow, Russia

Spartak Tennis Club also known as Shiryaevka, is a far cry away from the modern facilities and comfortable accommodation of the tennis academies in Florida. It is situated on the outskirts of Moscow and owing to the weather its 15 clay courts are open for only four months of the year; the rest of the time, students undergo their rigorous, old-fashioned training indoors. The academy’s success speaks for itself. Notable alumni include Grand Slam champions Yevgeny Kafelnikov, Anastasia Myskina and Marat Safin, as well as former top-ranked doubles player Anna Kournikova and singles number one Dinara Safina.

Surrey, UK

This international training centre is one of the best in the United Kingdom offering a wide variety of tennis programs to suit players of all levels both locally and internationally. They specialise in preparing young athletes for elite level through full-time training and tournament involvement. The facilities provide not only fantastic tennis courts but access to fitness equipment, Sports Psychology, Sports Physio clinic, as well as options to combine tennis with education and accommodation nearby.

The academy offers a flexible approach to meet the training and practice requirements of all levels of player, including professional, full-time and junior performance players, as well as beginners.

Mallorca, Spain

The Tennis Academy Mallorca (TAM) was founded in 1999 and is headed by the former Davis Cup player, Ali Yenilmez.

Their dedicated team comprises truly experienced international certified professional tennis coaches who ensure that, whatever your standard of play, an appropriate level of coaching is provided. The multilingual team provides coaching in English, German and Spanish all year-round.

Boris Becker, Charly Steeb, Tommy Haas and Steffi Graf are just a few of the professional players who have trained in this scenic setting between the sea and mountains. It is truly one of Spain’s top venues for tennis enthusiasts, professionals and families.

Umag, Croatia

Situated by the seaside, and offering first-rate accommodation and amenities, Umag Tennis Academy offers unique conditions for learning and having fun. Programs suitable for all age groups and levels of tennis skills enable all academy participants to enjoy an individual approach, to work on the particularly important segments of their game, and to focus on the details that are on the top of their priority list in terms of progress.

Besides Goran Ivanišević, Umag Tennis Academy partners with the Croatian Tennis Association, being its official regional centre, and the Lawn Tennis Association, which has chosen the Academy as its official overseas training base.

South Carolina, USA

Coach of numerous Grand Slam and National Junior Champions, Dennis Van der Meer's teaching career has spanned more than 50 years. He is known as the 'teacher of teachers'.

His Tennis Academy is dedicated to providing personalized, performance-driven tennis instruction, along with rigorous fitness training and family-oriented housing, so that recruited players acquire the athletic and life skills to successfully pursue college scholarships and/or tennis careers as high-powered players and respectful global citizens.

The academy uses an integrated approach and commitment to on-court tennis training, physical training, mental toughness, nutrition, tournament scheduling and injury prevention.

A wide range of Tennis Academy programs are available including full-time, vacation programs, and summer programs.

Mallorca, Spain

Vilas Tennis Academy was founded on the same philosophy that took Guillermo Vilas to the top, revolutionizing the world of tennis, introducing a new style based on the principles of hard work, dedication and winning mentality leading to a path that includes 62 ATP titles, 4 Grand Slams and 1 Masters title.

Vilas Academy is located in Palmova Beach, 15 minutes from Palma de Mallorca Airport, Balearic Islands. Tennis packages include complete tennis programs and tennis camps, for junior and adult players of all levels including hotel accommodation walking distance from the Academy with free airport transfers.

The club has 10 clay courts, and 2 synthetic courts. These two surfaces allow the preparation of players for every kind of tournaments of the ITF, ATP and WTA calendar.

California, USA

Since 1997, Weil Tennis Academy and College Preparatory School has placed 100% of its students into top NCAA universities and colleges such as: Stanford, Duke, UCLA, Brown, Dartmouth, Johns Hopkins, Princeton, Yale, Pepperdine, Cornell, UC Berkeley, USC and more, mostly on scholarship.

At Weil, the teachers, coaches, players, and families are all focused first on college preparation and college placement. The goal for every one of the students is to gain admission, study, and play college tennis at the most prestigious universities in America.

Weil's professional international coaching staff travels with players to over 100 tournaments per year around the globe including ITF, WTA, ATP, USTA National, sectional & regional events.
